texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: If you have to use short e-mail usernames in Plesk (which is a bad idea), and someone accidentally sets the server to use full usernames, you can force Plesk to go back. You can't do this in the interface, however. Plesk realizes that duplicate mail names exist, and it wont allow the change.
texts.text: If you have to use short e-mail usernames in Plesk (which is a bad idea), and someone accidentally sets the server to use full usernames, you can force Plesk to go back. You can't do this in the interface, however. Plesk realizes that duplicate mail names exist, and it wont allow the change.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Unable to allow the use of short mail names for POP3/IMAP accounts. There are mail names matching the encrypted passwords.
texts.text: Unable to allow the use of short mail names for POP3/IMAP accounts. There are mail names matching the encrypted passwords.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Forcing it back is easy with one SQL statement:
texts.text: Forcing it back is easy with one SQL statement:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
# mysql -u admin -p`cat /etc/psa/.psa.shadow` psa
mysql> UPDATE misc set val='enabled' where param='allow_short_pop3_names';
texts.text:
# mysql -u admin -p`cat /etc/psa/.psa.shadow` psa
mysql> UPDATE misc set val='enabled' where param='allow_short_pop3_names';

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Keep in mind that users logging in with shortnames will get into the same mailbox if they have the same username and password.
texts.text: Keep in mind that users logging in with shortnames will get into the same mailbox if they have the same username and password.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: How can I change back the option "Use of short and full POP3/IMAP mail account names is allowed" forcedly?
texts.text: How can I change back the option "Use of short and full POP3/IMAP mail account names is allowed" forcedly?
